intro: Sciadocephala dressleri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of bright blue or violet flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Sciadocephala dressleri requires well-draining soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
